Application.Apps.DAC.Hardware_Control.ADC¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

ADS_8166

Class for the used Octal ADC ADS 816x from Ti
class ADS_8166(cs_pin, spi, muxer)[source]¶

Class for the used Octal ADC ADS 816x from Ti Datasheet: https://www.ti.com/lit/ds/symlink/ads8166.pdf?ts=1619135690040&ref_url=https%253A%252F%252Fwww.google.com%252F Initialises the ADC

Parameters

  • cs_pin (int) – The Output Line of the Multiplexer which is connected to the ADC

  • spi (SpiDev spi) – The SPI Interface to be used for communication

  • muxer (Multiplexer Object) – The Multiplexer which controls the CS Routing

xfer(self, data)[source]¶

Wrapper for SPI xfer function additionally handles CS Line and SPI Mode Selection

Parameters

data (list of int) – Data for SpiDev xfer function

Returns

returned Data of SpiDev xfer function

Return type

list of int

read(self, reg)[source]¶

Single Register Read function as specified for the ADC in the Datasheet

Parameters

reg (int) – Register to be read

Returns

Value of specified Register

Return type

int

write(self, reg, value)[source]¶

Single Register Write function as specified for the ADC in the Datasheet

Parameters

  • reg (int) – Register the value should be written to

  • value (int) – Value to be written to the Register

set_spi_mode(self, spi_mode=1)[source]¶

Change SPI Mode of the ADC. At startup spi mode of the ADC is always 01

Parameters

spi_mode (int, optional) – Desired SPI Mode. Defaults to 0b01.

write_access(self, enable=True)[source]¶

Enable Write Access to the ADC Registers.

Parameters

enable (bool, optional) – Whether Write Access should be enabled or not. Defaults to True.

enabled_channel_id(self)[source]¶

Enable broadcast of Channel ID before Data Frame.

debug_mode(self, enable=True)[source]¶

Set the Debug Mode of the ADC on or off. In Debug mode the ADC returns fixed Data Values as described in the Datasheet.

Parameters

enable (bool, optional) – Whether to turn debug mode on or off. Defaults to True.

select_channel(self, channel, debug=False)[source]¶

Selects the channel of which the ADC should broadcast Data.

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel 1-8 of which the ADC should broadcast the Voltage

  • debug (bool, optional) – Enables/Disables Print statement for debugging Purposes. Defaults to False.

on_the_fly_mode(self, enable=True)[source]¶

Enables the on the fly Readout mode of the ADC

Parameters

enable (bool, optional) – Enable/Disable. Defaults to True.

convert_single_value(self, value)[source]¶

Converts the LSB Value to a Voltage in Volts. Based on the specified Voltage Divider Resistors and the Voltage Reference (internal V_ref=4.096V)

Parameters

value (int) – Voltage Register Value in LSB which should be converted

Returns

Converted Value in Volts

Return type

float

convert_values(self, values)[source]¶

For one value same Function as convert_single_value. For list of values in LSB converts all of them to Volts using convert_single_value.

Parameters

values (int or list of int) – LSB Voltage Values

Returns

The converted value(s)

Return type

float or list of float

get_values_on_the_fly(self, channels)[source]¶

Get Values of the ADC when it is in on the fly Mode.

Parameters

channels (list of int) – Channels to get the voltage data from

Returns

Voltage Values of channels in LSB

Return type

list of int

get_voltage(self, channel, std=0.01, samples=100)[source]¶

Gets Voltage of specified channel in Default ADC Mode. Takes samples Measurements of channel till the STD of samples consecutive Values is smaller than std.

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel index 0-7

  • std (float, optional) – Upper Limit of Standard Deviation for 100 Measurments. Defaults to 0.01.

  • samples (int,optional) – Samples to be taken. Defaults to 100

Returns

Mean Voltage of Channel over samples Measurements

Return type

float

get_all_voltages(self)[source]¶

Gets the Voltage from all eight channels

Returns

Voltages from all eight channels

Return type

np.array
